publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2085# Mr Ted Brocklebank: St Andrews World Heritage Site Status—That the Parliament supports a campaign to encourage the UK Government to obtain World Heritage Site status from UNESCO for St Andrews; recognises that St Andrews is the home of golf, the world’s fastest-growing sport and that it is also the historic ecclesiastical capital of Scotland; believes that its cultural and educational contributions, in particular Scotland’s oldest university, should be formally acknowledged; notes that St Andrews is regarded worldwide as unique, not only for its medieval town centre, but also for its captivating and award-winning natural features, and considers that the Scottish Executive should support St Andrews as an eminently-suitable Scottish candidate for the UK Tentative List. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Margaret Mitchell*, Alex Johnstone*

S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Murdo Fraser*, Phil Gallie*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr David Davidson*, Murray Tosh*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*
S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Alex Neil*, David Mundell*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mary Scanlon*

S2M-2085# Mr Ted Brocklebank: St Andrews World Heritage Site Status—That the Parliament supports a campaign to encourage the UK Government to obtain World Heritage Site status from UNESCO for St Andrews; recognises that St Andrews is the home of golf, the world’s fastest-growing sport and that it is also the historic ecclesiastical capital of Scotland; believes that its cultural and educational contributions, in particular Scotland’s oldest university, should be formally acknowledged; notes that St Andrews is regarded worldwide as unique, not only for its medieval town centre, but also for its captivating and award-winning natural features, and considers that the Scottish Executive should support St Andrews as an eminently-suitable Scottish candidate for the UK Tentative List. Supported by: Mr Jamie McGrigor, Margaret Mitchell, Alex Johnstone, Murdo Fraser, Phil Gallie, Tricia Marwick, Mr David Davidson, Murray Tosh, Mrs Nanette Milne, Rob Gibson, Robin Harper, Alex Neil, David Mundell, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mary Scanlon, Bill Aitken*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Chris Ballance*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Christine Grahame*
S2M-2085# St Andrews World Heritage Site Status (lodged on 29 November 2004) Alex Fergusson*, David McLetchie*, Miss Annabel Goldie*, John Scott*
